sen.j: 東洞院通（ひがしのとういんどおり）は京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Higashi-no-Toin-dori Street is a north-south running street in Kyoto City.
The Higashi-no-Toin-dori Street is a street which runs north-south in Kyoto City.
The Higashinotoin-dori Street is a street which runs north-south in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は丸太町通から南は京都駅まで。
sen.e: It extends from the Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to Kyoto Station in the south.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to Kyoto Station in the south.
It extends from Marutamachi-dori Street in the north to Kyoto Station in the south.

sen.j: 京都駅を挟んで南側の延長線上に竹田街道がある。
sen.e: The Takeda-kaido Road runs as if extended on the opposite side--northern side-- of Kyoto Station.
Takeda-kaido Road runs as if it extends on the opposite side--northern side-- of Kyoto Station.
Takeda-kaido Road runs as if it extends on the opposite side--northern side-- of Kyoto Station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 平安京の東洞院大路にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Higashi-no-Toi-no-Oji / Higashi-no-Toin-Oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Higashi-no-Toi-no-Oji / Higashi-no-Toin-Oji Street of Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Higashinotoin-no-Oji / Higashinotoin-Oji Street of Heiankyo.

sen.j: 「洞院」とは太上天皇・法皇の居所を意味し、平安時代には通り沿いに多くの院があった。
sen.e: "Toin! refers to the residence of Ex-Emperor (Daijo-tenno), later ex-emperor monk, and there were many residences of the nobility along the road during the Heian era.
"Toin! refers to the residence of the Ex-Emperor (Daijo-tenno), later ex-emperor monk, and there were many residences of many nobility were located along the road during the Heian era.
Toin' refers to the residence of the Retired Emperor (Daijo-tenno), Cloistered Emperor, and there were many residences of many nobility were located along the road during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: "→'太上天皇・法皇の表記修正時代の表記修正"retired" -> "Retired"、"cloistered" -> "Cloistered" に変更しました。

sen.j: 江戸時代には竹田街道に通じる幹線道路となり、混雑が激しいことから享保年間には北行き一方通行の規制が行なわれた。
sen.e: During the Edo era, the road became an arterial highway connected to the Takeda-kayo Road, and became so busy that one-way northbound traffic was imposed.
During the Edo era, the road became a primary highway connected to Takeda-kayo Road, and became so busy that one-way northbound traffic was imposed.
During the Edo period, the road became a primary highway connected to Takeda-kaido Road, and became so busy that one-way northbound traffic was imposed during the Kyoho era.
sen.cmt: during the Kyoho era補足スペルを修正

sen.j: 一方通行の規制としては日本でもっとも古いものといわれる。
sen.e: It is said to be Japan's oldest on-way road.
It is said to be Japan's oldest one-way road.
It is said to be Japan's oldest one-way road.

sen.j: 現状
sen.e: Current Status
Current Status
Current status

sen.j: 明治の街路拡幅で烏丸通に市電が通ってから、幹線道路の役割を譲った。
sen.e: The role of the arterial highway was taken over by the Karasuma-dori Street, when it was widened in a road widening project to open the Municipal Streetcar system in the Meiji era.
The role of primary highway was taken over by Karasuma-dori Street, when it was widened in a road widening project designed to open the Municipal Streetcar system in the Meiji era.
The role of primary highway was taken over by Karasuma-dori Street, when it was widened in a road widening project designed to open the Municipal Streetcar system in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 七条通と塩小路通の間のみは片側二車線であるが、それ以外の区間は一方通行の細い道である。
sen.e: It is a narrow one-way street excluding the section between the Shichijo-dori Street and Shiokoji-dori Street and two-lane each that has two lanes each.
It is a narrow one-way street excluding the section between Shichijo-dori Street and Shiokoji-dori Street which consist of two-lanes on each side.
It is a narrow one-way street excluding the section between Shichijo-dori Street and Shiokoji-dori Street which consist of two-lanes on each side.
